name: Martins Haven - The Deer Park Walk

ai.summary: A 6.5 km moderate hike through a deer park setting at Martins Haven, combining woodland tracks and open meadows with opportunities to spot wildlife. Suitable for walkers with steady footing and a willingness to cover varied terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-maintained trails of grass, gravel, and compact earth. Expect some uneven woodland paths and occasional muddy patches, with gentle gradients. Conditions can be slippery after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and appropriate clothing. Stay on marked paths and obey park guidelines. Watch for uneven ground and seasonal wildlife; keep a respectful distance from deer. Bring water, sun protection, and a light layer for changing weather. If dogs are allowed, keep them on a short lead and under control.
recommended_gear: Light headlamp or flashlight (for dusk walks)
ai.best_seasons: All year, with the best conditions typically from late spring to early autumn when trails are dry and wildlife is active.

seo.meta_description: Explore Martins Haven's Deer Park Walk, a 6.5 km moderate hike featuring woodland trails, open meadows, and wildlife spotting opportunities. Ideal for walkers with moderate fitness.
